medical_history.chief_complaint: Complete flaccid paralysis after electroshock treatment.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms developed a few hours after the second electroshock treatment, starting with the patient sitting on the floor and unable to get up without aid. The patient's condition progressed to complete flaccid paralysis with bilateral weakness of facial muscles, absence of reflexes, and increasing temperature before death on May 10.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a history of convulsions at age 2, was nervous and high-strung, and had irregular menses for the past 2 years. She underwent gallbladder operation and appendectomy in April 1947, after which she became depressed and restless.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was a housewife. Not specified if any other lifestyle factors contributed.
